New Records: Jordan Walker became the third-youngest Cardinal to get five hits in a game, at 22 years, 102 days, trailing Frank Snyder (21 years, 86 days) and Rogers Hornsby (20 years, 62 days)
Key Match Events: Jordan Walker hit a long two-run homer in the fifth and drove in three runs
Lars Nootbaar hit a bases-clearing two-strike double in the seventh and added a two-run homer in the ninth
Victor Scott II hit an RBI double and scored on a throwing error by reliever Phil Bickford
Post-Match Reflections: New York's lead in the American League East over Baltimore was trimmed to a half-game
Aaron Boone said 'We just couldnâ€™t close out that inning'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals set season highs for runs and hits (21) and were 8 for 18 with runners in scoring position
The Cardinals finished with at least 20 hits for the first time since totaling 23 at Cincinnati Sept. 1, 2020
Others: Rookie Masyn Wynn hit a two-run double and Luken Baker hit a two-run homer in a four-run fourth off Nestor Cortes for the Cardinals
Giancarlo Stanton homered and Jazz Chisholm Jr. scored on an error in the second
Aaron Judge remained at 51 homers, going homerless for the sixth straight game
